page.title: 06 VARIETY OF LIFESTYLES
page.content: In Stratford many houses are large Victorian terraces, catering for the summer influx of tourists. Shottery,on the outskirts, is in a picturesque setting with many expensive houses and cottages with well-cultivated gardens and double garages. The villages of Luddington and Clifford Chambers are more rural, and transport to Stratford is essential for residents. Generally, Stratford shops are expen- sive because of the tourist industry. However, second-hand clothes shops co- exist with small boutiques.One betting shop has recently closed;but gambling is popular at the racecourse. Subcultures are limited to Ely Street in cental Stratford. They consist mainly of young people:-punks,scooter boys and a few Heavy Metal motorbike enthusiasts.
